column1: Sertoli-Leydig cell tumor is a rare cancer of the ovaries.
The cancer cells produce and release a male sex hormone.
The Leydig cells, also located in the testes, release a male sex hormone called testosterone.
A Sertoli-Leydig cell tumor is a cancer that starts in the female ovaries, usually in younger women.
The cancer cells release a male sex hormone.

As a result, the woman may develop symptoms such as: - A deep voice - Enlarged clitoris - Facial hair - Loss in breast size - Stopping of menstrual periods Pain in the lower belly (pelvic area) is another symptom.
